name: Middlebury Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is my second time staying there but third time booked. I stayed once last spring. Then I was booked the weekend of Hurricane Sandy and actually drove there only to ask if I could reschedule as I was worried about my home. They very graciously allowed me to reschedule until April and gave me all I had originally prepaid. They were so kind about it then and now. As for our stay this week, it was perfect. First all the things that come free with your room: wifi, computer and printer in lobby, coffee in the morning, afternoon tea with hot and cold beverages with cookies and pound cake. We stayed in the main part of the inn (room 111) in a lovely room on the first floor. King size, very comfortable bed, refrigerator, large tv, etc. Great view of the square. Quality toiletries, towels, etc. They do have an elevator but it must be run by an employee due to the style. It is actually quite cool looking. Any staff I asked to help me with the elevator were extremely pleasant. However I believe if mobility is an issue it is best to stay in the annex where you can be on the ground floor. I felt bad asking the staff to get the elevator since sometimes they had to walk up the stairs to get it. No one on the staff ever made me feel this way, as I said they were all very nice about it, it was just my own feeling of not wanting to bother people. If you stay in the annex it may not look exciting from the outside but it is beautiful inside. I stayed there last spring and loved it. The lobby area and restaurant at the inn are gorgeous. I suggest eating breakfast, for sure, at the inn but other meals too (I will do a separate review for Morgan's Tavern). The food is excellent. Overall I have to say that EVERYONE at the inn was very friendly and helpful from check-in to waitresses to housekeeping. All this and a great location make this my new tradition!
reviews.title: Second time there-perfect again!

reviews.text: Everything you'd want in an historic inn... except for no food on Monday and Tuesday evenings. I get that they may not have much traffic, but we booked in while floor work was done and, especially for h/c, even a tureen of soup, crackers, and salad would have been better than loading my power chair in 28º weather, hobbling from car to restaurant and back again.
reviews.title: Great Place for a Handicap Stay but...

reviews.text: Literally. what a pain: 7/10.
reviews.title: Charming historic inn

reviews.text: On the other hand, we were treated well and felt at home.
reviews.title: Location can't be beat but needs updating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great place to stay when looking at Middlebury College or just on a visit to Vermont. I was thrilled to come back here, especially with a groupon. The inn upgraded our room; the bathroom was huge! The innkeeper could not have been more helpful ehen I realized I had forgotten to print the groupon. We were so tired when we arrived after leaving Boston mid-afternoon, so we had dinner in the inn. It was delicious! We devoured the baked brie and enjoyed our entrees, mushroom raviolis and salmon. Cannot wait to return!
reviews.title: Nice Getaway...

reviews.text: Arrived on Saturday night Feb 16 and after checking in we decided to eat at the restaurant within the Inn. My wife and I both ordered a Scallop Fettuccine dish. When the food was served it was in a bowl with about an inch of broth. Not at all what the menu descried. When we searched for the fettuccine the closest we came were a couple green globs of pasta mush. No discernible noodles. The scallop were done nicely but the rest of the bowl (on a dish that should have been plated) was a mess. Also, I ordered the Onion soup as an appetizer which when arrived had lots of raw onion in it (shouldn't they be caramelized or at least cooked soft?), with a tasteless broth to go with. Upon noting this to the wait staff (they were always pleasant) we were offered a free desert but we weren't feeling up to it after our dinner experience. We were charged full price for the dinner with the tip that came to about $170. The following couple nights we were in Middlebury the Inn restaurant was quiet but the other places in town were very busy. We didn't mind waiting a 1/2 hour at the other places we went, the food was great. Supposedly the Scallop dish is off the menu but if you see it I would avoid it. By the way, I am in my 50's and this is the first trip advisor I have ever written - I don't want others to experience the food that we did. They need a new head chef, it was definitely Ramsey's Kitchen Nightmare material. Sorry for the bad review to the Middlebury Inn, but they should have had least comped the main course, we couldn't eat it!
reviews.title: Restaurant food was poor to inedible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Inn itself was OK for staying at. We were in the annex so can't comment too much on the charm of the main house.
reviews.title: Can't sleep at Middlebury Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Quaint Vermont inn, but unfortunately, with steam heat and perhaps old plumbing, the many different noises we heard in our room during the night prevented us from having a decent night's sleep. So sad because it appears to be the quintessential Vermont inn.
reviews.title: Old Hotel Kept up Well

reviews.text: We had gone to the inn due to a sniqueaway I bought for my husband and I to get away. Nice old building, kept up well. Clean bathroom with oversized tub and nice front desk people. Breakfast was good.
reviews.title: Wear shoes in the bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sniqueaway is supposed to be a bargain but I feel we paid what was average price for the inn. If it is actually more expensive then I would deem it a bit high priced.
reviews.title: Inn experience
Gorgeous Inn
reviews.text: We loved this historic inn, within walking distance of downtown and a member of Historic Hotels of America. Our room was a combination of 2 small rooms, and was a bit weird (2 bathrooms, etc), but it was just fine. Middlebury is a fantastic town.

I stayed at the Middlebury Inn for one night while I was in Vermont and wished I could have stayed longer. The Inn is absolutely gorgeous with spacious rooms and lovely decor. When I checked in, I even found out they upgraded my room which was a wonderful surprise. Everyone who worked there was very friendly and helpful as well. I ate at the restaurant at the Inn for both dinner and lunch while I was there and the food phenomenal. I highly recommend the onion soup . . . it was delicious and warmed me right up on a cold December night. Thanks to everyone at the Middlebury Inn for making my stay so enjoyable . . . I hope to visit again soon!
reviews.title: Quintessential Vermont Inn!

reviews.text: This is a very special hotel. Feels really historic and quaint. We had a room that was enormous with tall ceilings and what was really awesome was there were 2 bathrooms, all for a very reasonable price. I was also very impressed with the food. We had an amazing dinner and breakfast at the restaurant. Staff was great. Would have been nice to have a gym on site but it is a quick easy drive to a local gym which is complementary.
reviews.title: Rooms are huge

reviews.text: We just had the most wonderful time with our three young daughters at Middlebury Inn's Christmas character breakfast in the founder's room. The food was yummy, the tickets were affordable for local families, and the room just looked perfect, with tasteful, festive decorations festooning the classy function space. Comfortable, quality chairs and the smiling staff kept the buffet well-supplied. One even volunteered to take our whole family picture with one of the characters so Dad could be part of it. The half-dozen or so Christmas characters in costume were very good with the children, and the balloon for each child was a welcome surprise. Really a very special morning, like an hour at Disney but without the plane ride. Thank you, Middlebury Inn!
reviews.title: Christmas breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was looking for a getaway in the mountains. Booked a deal for 2 nights for $199 and a $30 credit toward food. We arrived 2 hours before check in time it was 1pm, we were able to check in and were even upgraded to a king bed.The room was nice with a jacuzzi tub in the marble bathroom. We were on the top floor with a nice view of the commons. They have complimentary coffee/tea in the AM and afternoon tea with scones or cookies in the afternoon. Walk to everything downtown Middlebury has.
reviews.title: A romantic place to stay

reviews.text: We spent one wonderful evening at the Inn with dinner in the Morgan Tavern. Menu was full of fresh, well prepared and presented offerings. Service was very friendly and the staff was alert but not hovering. We received a room upgrade upon check in and the room was very comfortable and clean. The Inn is 186 years old but the amenities are very up to date. We also enjoyed the afternoon tea in the lobby which was a nice way to relax after a long drive through the mountains. I tried the Breadloaf french toast with fresh maple syrup for breakfast while looking out at the snow swirling around the common. This is a relaxing place to stay if you are in the area.
reviews.title: relaxing and delicious

reviews.text: No, it's not Downton Abbey in Middlebury. It's better. You'll have all the charm, comfort, and location of a piece of American history and won't have to hire the staff or keep the damp away from the brick.
reviews.title: Downton Abbey in Vermont

reviews.text: I've previously reviewed this Inn as feeling like a British private club. It's even friendlier and more comfortable than before. Helpful, gracious, and attentive staff throughout. Plated breakfasts are superb, as is the complimentary afternoon tea. Walk to Middlebury College, the Vermont Coop and shops, and numerous good restaurants. Relax and enjoy!
reviews.title: Great Old Inn in New England Setting

reviews.text: The Inn is located right in town and walking distance to everything. Right on the town square, it is really picturesque New ENgland as you drive up to it. We were suprised that our room was actually around back in a mosre typical motel style addition, but just the same it was clean and a really nice room. Lots of parking available, and the staff was really helpful and nice. Definitely has the feeling of northern New England, which we love. And the main building was really beautiful, with a wonderful looking dining room. We ate at a local restaurant, which they were happy to recommend.
reviews.title: Really wanted to like this place more...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reviews on this site and sister SniqueAway (where I had booked a prepaid overnight as part of a special) led me to expect more.
reviews.title: Spectacular!!!!

description: Historic Vermont Lodging - Enjoy warm Vermont hospitality in the heart of Middlebury, a vibrant college town with classic New England character. Welcoming travelers since 1827, the Middlebury Inn offers the perfect blend of modern comfort and classic historic charm. Centrally located between Burlington and Rutland, and convenient to so many of Vermont's attractions, our historic Middlebury, Vermont hotel is perfect for that pampered fresh-air getaway, a family reunion, a base for leaf peeping, bike touring, hiking or cross country skiing, and also to host your organization's professionally managed retreat. Our town is surrounded by thousands of acres of the Green Mountain National Forest as well as numerous trails and back country roads which are ideal for biking, running, hiking, and cross-country skiing. Friendly Lake Dunmore and spectacular Lake Champlain are easy drives from the Inn. For downhill skiing, the family-friendly Middlebury College Snow Bowl is nearby and Sugarbush, Mad River, Killington, and Stowe are all within 40 miles of the Inn.
